headline.main: José García Nieto -- Poet and Novelist, 86

lead_paragraph: José García Nieto, a poet and novelist who won the 1996 Cervantes literature prize in Spain for his lifelong contribution to the Spanish language, died here on Tuesday. He was 86. Inspired by Roman Catholicism, he frequently referred in his work to the traditional values of God, country and family as they were being espoused by the government of Gen. Francisco Franco. His first novel, ''Vísperas Hacia Ti'' (''Vespers Toward You'') was published in 1940 at the end of the Spanish Civil War.
abstract: Jose Garcia Nieto, poet and novelist, dies at age 86 (S)
